clinical_syndrome: Patient had body aches, severe dyspnea, vomiting, fever, all severe for one week in March 2020, presumed to be Covid but tested negative. Went to ER for chest pain but neg cxr and neg ecg. Still w fever and dyspnea day 20
unusual: took ivermectin on day 20. felt completely back to normal the next day and has remained so a month later

comments.body: Dr. Lieberman, thanks for sharing these cases. Can you provide more detail on what your rationale was for using Ivermectin in these patients? Any idea how long the patient’s had been experiencing symptoms? It’s surprising that there seemed to be such rapid improvements (24-48hrs). Thanks very much for the additional info!

I read the in vitro study about ivermectin preventing Sars Co V from replicating that was published early in March. After I learned that the drug is safe and widely used, and has few side effects (especially in those who do not have parasites since the main side effects are from the die-off of the parasites), a family friend was sick with Covid and I asked if she wanted to experiment on herself with a dose of Covid. She agreed. She's the white woman who took it on day one of her disease, which was also day 14 of her husband's Covid disease (he's the one who took it on day 20). She was better the next day. I have a whole case series I can email you if you want. alexissloanlieberman@gmail.com

Dr. Lieberman, if you would like to email us at cureadmin@mail.nih.gov, we will be happy to upload the additional cases in your case series on your behalf. This is something we can do for other healthcare providers as well that have larger datasets they would like to contribute, but don't wish to enter manually. Thank you for contributing your experience to CURE ID.

why_new_way.answer: There is no standard/approved therapy for this disease

when_outcome: At the time the treatment was completed
additional_info:
During his hospital course, the patient had been treated with Hydroxychloroquine and Azithromycin and was on high dose steroids after a dose of tocilizumab.  
His chest x-ray was worsening as was his oxygenation.  He was on 50 liters high flow oxygen trying to avoid intubation. 
His D-Dimer was greater than 20, and the patient was started on full dose lovenox.  
The patient and his wife requested that the treating physician try Ivermectin (0.2 mg/kg x 1 dose).  
The treating physician agreed after full informed consent and chart review to look for contraindications and drug to drug interactions. 
 Within 3-4 days, the patient was afebrile, his respiratory rate dropped to 16-18

why_new_way.answer: There is no standard/approved therapy for this disease

other_comorbid: intermittent asthma that was well controlled on Advair
when_outcome: At the time the treatment was completed
additional_info:
treated with azithromycin after 8 days of fever, chills, worsening dyspnea unresponsive to Albuterol, headache, fatigue, and weakness. 

 Despite azithromycin, her dyspnea worsened, and she was hospitalized from days 10-12 of illness for oxygen saturations in the mid-80s and presumed COVID-19 despite a negative NP PCR. 
 A full viral panel was negative and COVID-19 IgG antibody was detected during week 3 of illness.  

She continued to have relapses of fever, headache, and dyspnea and was treated with Ivermectin 0.2 mg/kg x 1 early in her 5th week of illness with full resolution of fever and headache and improvement in dyspnea and exercise tolerance within 48 hours of treatment.

clinical_syndrome: fevers, chills, anosmia, and fatigue. 'Covid toes'
when_outcome: At the time the treatment was completed
additional_info:
Testing was arranged and was positive for Covid-19.  Pros and cons of an unverified treatment were discussed and ultimately selected by the parents who were worried about possible spread within their household.  
The patient’s smell returned within 24-48 hours and her fever resolved.  The 1st toe progressed to paronychia that required lancing.
